page.title: 16Newcastle Amateur Theatre
page.content: Amateur Theatres include then{New {Tyne}(Westgate Road) and the{People's} (Heaton).The New Tyne, specialising in operetta, is unique in the world for its Victorian/Edwardian stage machinery.The People's, one of whose first patrons was Bernard Shaw who made his last public performance here, is 77 years old.It was the first Art Centre in Britain and still puts on every year main productions, 3 studio productions and a pantomime(of 5 performances each) on the largest amateur stage in the world.There are 175 members,the President being the novelist Sid Chaplin. Community theatres funded by the City Council include{Bruvvers}and the cooperative{Skin and Bones,}whose company of 6 provides accessible theatre to a wide age range throughout the inner city area of Newcastle.
